#EtymologyOfTheDay: LIVID, from Latin LIVIDUS, first meant BLUISH-GRAY. The color became associated with faces paled, or livid with, anger.

@jmarkwrite Initial sound of ‘usual’ is actually a glide (y-sound, a semi-vowel). ‘Historic’ pronunciations depends on aspiration of ‘h’.

ICYMI: The KILTER (1620s) in OFF/OUT OF KILTER means “good condition,” a variant of KELTER. Its origin is simply unknown. #EtymologyOfTheDay
